subject: Automobile Racing
Suspensions, Dismissals and Resignations
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Nascar suspended indefinitely seven crew members for Joe Gibbs Racing for attempting to manipulate a horsepower test after a Nationwide Series race last weekend. While Nascar decided against barring the cars from future races, the penalties were among the harshest it had levied. The crew chiefs Jason Ratcliff and Dave Rogers were suspended and fined $50,000 each. The drivers Tony Stewart and Joey Logano were each docked 150 driver points. Gibbs Racing was stripped of 150 owner points for each car and placed on probation for the rest of the season.
